Prime Minister's Decision No. 2497 of 2025 - Official Gazette Issue 44 bis (A)

New Decision Published in Official Gazette No. 44 bis (A) on November 2, 2025

Prime Minister Dr. Mostafa Madbouly issued Decision No. 2497 of 2025, published in Official Gazette Issue 44 bis (A) on November 2, 2025, extending the work of committees tasked with surveying areas containing premises rented for residential purposes under the old rent law No. 164 of 2025.

âš–ï¸ Decision Summary

The work of survey committees has been extended for an additional three months starting from November 5, 2025, to complete the surveying and assessment of premises rented under old lease contracts.

Ministerial Decision Details

This decision was issued based on:

  • Review of the Egyptian Constitution
  • The Civil Code
  • Law No. 164 of 2025 regarding certain provisions related to premises rental laws and reorganization of the relationship between landlord and tenant
  • Prime Minister's Decision No. 2789 of 2025 regarding rules and regulations for committees surveying areas with residential rental premises
  • Approval of the Minister of Local Development

Text of the decision published in the Official Gazette

What are Survey Committees?

Survey committees are specialized committees formed under the new rental law to perform the following tasks:

  • Survey of rented premises: Identifying all residential premises subject to old rent law provisions
  • Assessment and inspection: Evaluating the condition of rented premises and determining appropriate rental values
  • Data documentation: Collecting and documenting all data related to old contracts
  • Report preparation: Submitting comprehensive reports to competent authorities for implementing the new law

Importance of This Decision

This decision comes within the framework of the state's commitment to implementing rules and regulations for organizing the relationship between landlord and tenant, aiming to:

ğŸ“‹ For Landlords

  • â€¢ Ensure they receive their financial rights
  • â€¢ Organize rental relationships fairly
  • â€¢ Enable reassessment of rented premises

ğŸ  For Tenants

  • â€¢ Protect their housing rights
  • â€¢ Gradual and organized law implementation
  • â€¢ Fair and balanced transition period

Practical Implementation

With the issuance of this decision, all concerned parties must:

  • Landlords: Cooperate with survey committees and provide all required documents
  • Tenants: Allow committees to inspect and provide original lease contracts
  • Government entities: Complete survey work within the specified period

Next Steps

After completion of survey committee work, the following will be done:

  1. Preparation of a comprehensive database of all rented premises
  2. Determination of appropriate rental value for each unit
  3. Gradual and organized implementation of the new law
  4. Resolution of existing disputes between landlords and tenants

Conclusion

The additional period for survey committee work provides a better opportunity to complete procedures accurately and comprehensively.

Il Primo Ministro Dr. Mostafa Madbouly ha emesso la Decisione n. 2497 del 2025, pubblicata sulla Gazzetta Ufficiale numero 44 bis (A) il 2 novembre 2025, prorogando il lavoro dei comitati incaricati del censimento delle aree contenenti locali affittati per scopi residenziali ai sensi della vecchia legge sugli affitti n. 164 del 2025.

  • Decisione del Primo Ministro n. 2789 del 2025 riguardante le regole e i regolamenti per i comitati che censurano le aree con locali residenziali affittati
  • Approvazione del Ministro dello Sviluppo Locale

Cosa sono i Comitati di Censimento?

I comitati di censimento sono comitati specializzati formati ai sensi della nuova legge sugli affitti per svolgere i seguenti compiti:

  • Censimento dei locali affittati: Identificazione di tutti i locali residenziali soggetti alle disposizioni della vecchia legge sugli affitti
  • Valutazione e ispezione: Valutazione dello stato dei locali affittati e determinazione dei valori di affitto appropriati
